scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 7 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
jury, men, forth, lary, in, router, tions, ode, groovy, lessons, cath

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — [masked] from; out of.
B. (1 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -er) — a power tool with a shaped cutter; used in carpentry for cutting grooves
C. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: in-) — a casualty to military personnel resulting from combat
D. (1 syllables) — Cool, neat, interesting.
E. (2 syllables) — make reference to
F. (1 syllables) — the significance of a story or event
G. (2 syllables) — That electrode of a semiconductor device which is connected to the n-type material of a p-n junction.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ty, tow, pro, er, ship, knox, tras, cie, gra, nounced, yard, uli, i, malay, tweaked, stress, com, plex, ing

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — Relation hint: Example usage: he put the [masked] on the wrong syllable — (physics) force that produces strain on a physical body
B. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Synonym: Allen — United States comedienne remembered as the confused but imperturbable partner of her husband, George Burns (1906-1964)
C. (1 syllables) — Relation hint: Can be used as adjective or noun — Of or related to [masked]sia, its people and/or culture.
D. (4 syllables) — Relation hint: Topic domain: noun.attribute — That which is and renders complex; intricacy; complication.
E. (1 syllables) — Relation hint: Topic domain: noun.person — Scottish theologian who founded Presbyterianism in Scotland and wrote a history of the Reformation in Scotland (1514-1572)
F. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Has vowel sequence 'ou' — strongly marked; assertive
G. (3 syllables) — Relation hint: Topic domain: adj.all — of imposing height; especially standing out above others
H. (2 syllables) — Relation hint: Starts with 'sh' — A place where ships are built and repaired.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Clues

C. (1 syllables) — A wedgie performed from in front of the victim.

E. (2 syllables) — Troublesome, cheeky, badly behaved, impish, naughty, disobedient; showing a fondness for causing trouble in a playful way and liking to have fun by playing harmless tricks on people or doing things they are not supposed to do.

G. (1 syllables) — an ancient city state on the north African coast near modern Tunis; founded by Phoenicians; destroyed and rebuilt by Romans; razed by Arabs in 697

Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
